About Me

I am passionate about entering the semiconductor industry and becoming a successful hardware design and verification engineer.

Skills

  • FPGA Design
  • VLSI Design
  • Signal Processing
  • Communication Systems

Professional Summary

  • Incoming graduate student in Electrical and Computer Engineering at Texas A&M University (Fall 2025), with a solid foundation in digital logic, computer architecture, and integrated circuit design. Skilled in Verilog-based RTL development, FPGA prototyping using Xilinx Vivado, and CMOS fundamentals through academic and project-based learning. Experienced in designing and verifying digital systems, building hardware prototypes, and working with microcontrollers and embedded platforms. Passionate about advancing knowledge in SoC design, analog and mixed-signal ICs, and digital VLSI, with a strong inclination toward silicon-aware architecture and system-level optimization. Actively seeking research or industry opportunities focused on high-performance computing, custom hardware accelerators, and full-stack hardware design.
